    • Method Detail

      • getValidParameters

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getValidParameters(HttpServletRequest request)
        Description copied from interface: ResponseHandler
        This method creates a map containing only signed parameters from the request + the signature. All methods working with SOP/HOP responses should rely ONLY on the parameters returned here otherwise the application will be vulnerable to attacks.
        Specified by:
        getValidParameters in interface ResponseHandler
        Parameters:
        request - SOP/HOP request
        Returns:
        Map containing the signed request parameters + the signature

      • processResponse

        public void processResponse(AbstractOrderModel order,
                            java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> paymentResponse)
        Description copied from interface: ResponseHandler
        Processes isv response and creates order payment transactions.
        Specified by:
        processResponse in interface ResponseHandler
        Parameters:
        order - the order
        paymentResponse - the payment response data

      • isDecisionSuccessful

        public boolean isDecisionSuccessful(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> paymentResponse)
        Specified by:
        isDecisionSuccessful in interface ResponseHandler
        Parameters:
        paymentResponse - the payment response data
        Returns:
        Indicates if the authorization for the payment was successful or not

      • isValidSignature

        public boolean isValidSignature(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> paymentResponse)
        Specified by:
        isValidSignature in interface ResponseHandler
        Parameters:
        paymentResponse - Map containing the signed fields from the request. This map should be the output from getValidParameters
        Returns:
        true/false indicating if the parameters have a valid signature. If the signature is not valid, the order should not be processed
